title: Antonio Banderas on Málaga's bright future, and why he keeps coming back
text:
It’s been 40 years since the Spanish actor Antonio Banderas left his hometown of Málaga to become a Hollywood star. Los ­Angeles furnished him with fame and fortune. And – incongruously, perhaps, for the actor best known for playing swashbuckling Zorro – he currently lives in the Surrey stockbroker-belt town of Cobham. But Málaga is the place he calls home.

“Definitely, this is home. And it has become more so since I left all those years ago. I’ve been missing it for many decades and it’s time for me to turn around and come back,” says Banderas, 59, while walking to his penthouse near the Roman theatre in Málaga’s historic centre. En route, he stops obligingly for selfies with passers-by.

description: It’s been 40 years since the Spanish actor Antonio Banderas left his hometown of Málaga to become a Hollywood star.
